title: Dans la Nuit  [dir. Charles Vanel] 1929
description:
Un ouvrier carrier se marie et vit son bonheur conjugal, jusqu'ÃƒÂ  ce qu'une explosion sur son lieu de travail le dÃƒÂ©figure. DÃƒÂ©sormais contraint de porter un masque, il est rejetÃƒÂ© par sa femme qui est alors attirÃƒÂ©e par un autre homme...

A quarry worker marries and the couple live happily until an explosion at the quarry disfigures the man. Forced to wear a mask to hide his deformity, he is eventually rejected by his wife, who is attracted to another man...


Dans la Nuit is one of only two films directed by French actor Charles Vanel. It is a silent film. As it was made just at the beginning of the sound era, it was almost completely ignored. Vanel was so disheartened by the film's failure that he never directed again.

This copy of Dans la Nuit is from a dvd made from a videotape. As you will see, the image quality is not so great, but you should be able to enjoy the film nonetheless. The rather odd intertitles are in French, but there are very few of them; if you know the basic story, you should be able to follow the action pretty well.

The soundtrack was composed by French clarinetist Louis Sclavis for the film's restoration in 2002. What a pity that it is just about impossible to find a copy of this film. If it has been restored, why not release it to dvd?
